str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Wise, learned, cultivated, skilled, clever. Akin to saphes; wise.
Master-builder, architect. From arche and tekton; a chief constructor, i.e. 'architect'.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To build upon (above) a foundation. From epi and oikodomeo; to build upon, i.e. to rear up.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To build upon (above) a foundation. From epi and oikodomeo; to build upon, i.e. to rear up.
